intro: Meiosperma eminii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to desert environments. Meiosperma eminii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
